Dear Mr. Powell:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on June 12,
2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
ISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that
violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved. For repeat violations,
please identify why efforts from previous CAPs were not successful in
achieving compliance, and how you will adjust your approach to assure
ongoing compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of six licensing files held a renewal evaluation which was not submitted timely.
The renewal was submitted on 3/16/20, 13 days prior to license expiration.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in the
agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(c) Conduct a thorough investigation including all necessary
collateral contacts.
Two of two special evaluations did not have all of the required information:
File one: The children in the home were not interviewed regarding the allegation, or
about discipline in the foster home.
File two: The investigation report did not have any interviews summarized.
R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a written
adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family signing an
adoption application and prior to approving a family for adoption.
One of three adoption evaluations was not completed in the required timeframe. The
family applied on 6/13/19. The study was not completed until 1/13/20.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
Renewal 6/7/19, CAP approved 6/29/19
Interim 8/17/18, CAP approved 8/31/18
4

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 801 Medicaid Card
Page 17-18
At the time of the first placement, the care provider shall be
given the Medicaid Number and a Medical Treatment
Authorization Card upon placement. Routine, Non-Surgical
Medical Care…
Two of three foster care files did not have the 3762 (Medical Authorization) located
in the file with documentation to show it was provided to the foster parent at
placement.
IV. ANALYST SAFETY CONCERNS:
No safety concerns were identified by the DCWL analyst.
V. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance during this review.
VI. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation during this review.
VII. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The CAP (approved 6/29/19) was required after the 6/7/19 renewal evaluation.
During this review, only one repeat violation was found. This violation was regarding
timeliness of an adoption evaluation. The agency noted that the evaluation was late
as the result of an adoption worker who is no longer with the agency. Overall, the
agency continues to show improvement in this area.
5

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules, ISEP requirements, or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
